description.en:
The first part of the course is devoted to Soviet history, its periods and their specific features.
Then the chronological sketches of the development of different arts follow. The basic part of the course is devoted to the analysis of different artificial texts of the epoch (incl. translations of literary texts, films, paintings, etc.).
description.et: Kursuse esimene pool on pühendatud NSVL ajaloole, selle perioodidele ja omakorda nende spetsiifikale. Edasi antakse kronoloogiline ülevaade nõukogudeaegsetest loominguga seotud valdkondade arengust. Nendealaste tekstide (kirjanduse, kino, kujutavakunsti jt) analüüsid moodustavad kursuse olulise osa.

objectives.en: The purpose of course is to give a picture of development of the culture of the Soviet era (both "Socialist realism" and its independent opponents). The cultural history of pre-Stalin, Stalin and post-Stalin periods will be taken in the connection with political struggle inside the communist party, social development of the country and mechanisms of the state control. The literature, art, cinema, music, theater, popular culture, architecture in the USSR will be discussed. Underground culture and civil-right activism are the subjects of the course also.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda ülevaade nõukogudeaja kultuuri arengust ("sotsialistlikust realismist ja selle sõltumatutest oponentidest). Stalini eelse, -aegse ja -järgse perioodide kultuurilugu saab käsitletud NLKP võitluse, riigi sotsiaalse arengu, riigi mehhanismide kontrolli seostes. Käsitletakse nõukogudeaegset kirjandust, kunsti, kino, muusikat, teatrit, arhitektuuri, massikultuuri. Vaatluse objektideks on samuti mitteametlik ehk avangardi kultuur ja kodanlik vastasseis (dissidentide liikumine).

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the student
1) gets acquainted with a historical context of the Soviet era;
learning_outcomes.et: 1)	on tuttav NSVL ajastu ajaloolise kontekstiga

learning_outcomes.en: 2) knows about a cultural life of the USSR (Russian, first of all) in the epoch;
3) receives the general concept about the main trends of Soviet music, film, art and literature;
learning_outcomes.et: 3)	omab üldist ettekujutust nõukogudeaegsetest muusika, kino ja kirjanduse suundadest

learning_outcomes.en: 4) understands cultural, social and political context of Socialist realism and (post) avant-garde.
learning_outcomes.et: 4)	saab aru sotsialistliku realismi ja (post)avangardi  kultuurilisest, sotsiaalsest ja poliitilisest kontekstist NSVL-s.

description.et: A final presentation and a five-page final paper will be devoted to chosen aspect of cultural life in the USSR/modern Russia and its reception in native students' culture
Works of art, documents, historical and critical writings.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: 1) Introduction. The first Russian revolution and the soviet project.
2) 1917 and formation of the Sovient culture (art, painting, theater, and cinema).
3) 1927 The first anniversary. The last days of NEP and half-freedom. Early soviet songs.
4) 1937 Pushkin's anniversary, Great Purge and the climax of the "socialism".
5) The multicultural Soviet culture: the concept of the "socialist internationalism".
6) 1947 WWII and Soviet culture. Stalin's Empire Of Arts: hterarchy of genres
8) The 60-s. Everyday life and recreation in Soviet Union
9) 1967 The early Brezhnev's era. Key texts of Soviet cinema
10) 1977 The late Brezhnev's era. The third wave of emigration.
12) 1987 Gorbachev's reforms. Perestroika and cultural transition in the USSR.
